its has gotten a lot better and mostly i feel very safe on campus even when i walk back to my dorm a 3am. But always becareful and watch your surrounding.
there is a small Greek life but it is basically no existent
it's Miami need we say more
Partiers Wanted to experience more Serious Students Beach bums
around campus we have lots of starbucs to study for the late nights and we also have an Indian grave yard close to barry. The beach is always awesome and after all it is miami so lots of attractions.
Tution is paid for about 70% to 90% the rest is made up by you. Always double check finanical aid and get recpiets if you can.
it is miami if your 18 and under look at mostly downtown. But above 21 the party never stops : Los olas south beach collins ave Dave and busters nikki beach and so much more!
The worst make sure you join a costco or bj's.

Boring and dramtic all at once. It is like a soap opera on campus some days are exciting and talked about others will put you to sleep . Always be clear with your room mate on everything and if not get the RA involved and if that does it work go to ResLife.
Great as long as you work hard there is no doubt about getting A's. Teachers are great to have as advisers and as references for internships and jobs

Lots of clicks don't get offended if you don't belong to them Eduction great best teachers here and if you work hard most will give you a great reference Boy are the worst here try not to date on campus. Watch your advisers closely some are great other will keep you there until you are 40.
Education and Teachers are the best thing that make Barry great. Everything else Barry could improve a little even if it is by fund raising.

Make sure that you know deadlines for payments and the changes made to your account 3. Park in areas that you can park, otherwise your car will be towed and you will get a ticket. 4. Join an organization or more, and be involved. 5. Most resident Halls are not that bad, just remember its an old university but in Fall 2012, there will be a new resident hall & if you can apply to live in the houses around campus. 6. If you are not Catholic, Barry doesn't mind they will accept anyway. 7. Focus on your studies, the better that you do the more that will shine. 8. Moonlight Madness is one of the most sporting events that the school hosts., 146762=It's expensive because it's a private university, but the classes are smaller which is better for 1:1 time. I think it's worth the money., 409028=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 29180=The food here is AMAZING for about the first four months, then you get sick of it. I stopped eating at the WOW by about January and started eating at the BUC stop, which can be pricey. So i stocked up on lots of snacks, noodles, mac n cheese, and it worked out. I didn't even like walking to the student union to eat so the snacks worked out well., 273001=If you are looking for a party school, Barry is not for you. The teacher student ratio is about 1:20. textAfterTable: Am learning a lot The education is okay, it could be better. It feels somewhat like high school, but the teachers truly care about their students. There are about 20 students in each class. The lectures are quite interesting. There are only few projects and essays. Login to rate or flag the reviews cammeron from Dunedin, FL 07/09/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 11 out of 12 people found this review useful. 3 of 106 Categories Comments Great for these types of students This school is very good for students who are serious about their career, because Barry offers lots of options and you will get the best learning one on one as you would not just get anywhere else. Tips for prospective students If you are going for sports a great place to get noticed. You will have a wonderful time on campus, it is so nice there. Bang for the buck
